revised_title: Dental Differentiation in St Kitts Green Monkeys and Comparative Analysis with Other Subspecies
tldr: The study investigates the influence of geographic isolation on the skull of the green monkey (Cercopithecus aethiops sabaeus) and the degree and speed of dental differentiation in the St Kitts green monkey. The research compares dental dimensions between the African and St Kitts green monkeys with other subspecies and species of the Cercopithecus genus. The findings show that the St Kitts green monkey's dental dimensions have increased significantly during the last 300 years, with the speed of change being much faster than the estimated rate of evolution in horses over millions of years.
